meanings.definition: To drive away or urge to go away by or as if by crying 'shoo'
meanings.sent1: I had to shoo the cat out of the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: Please shoo the flies away from the food.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to shoo the clouds from the sky.
meanings.sent4: He tried to shoo away his worries like pesky insects.
meanings.sent5: The scarecrow's job is to shoo the birds from the crops.

meanings.definition: Used to express impatience, disapproval, or disbelief
meanings.sent1: Shoo! I can't believe you did that!
meanings.sent2: Oh shoo! That's not fair at all.
meanings.sent3: Shoo, don't interrupt me when I'm talking.
meanings.sent4: Shoo, that's the silliest thing I've heard all day!
meanings.sent5: Shoo! I'm so frustrated with this situation.

meanings.definition: A cry used to frighten away animals or birds
meanings.sent1: The loud shoo scared the pigeons away.
meanings.sent2: I heard a shoo coming from the garden.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's shoo made the squirrel run up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The shoo echoed through the empty barn.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's shoo was so loud, it startled the horses.
